required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MR-guided Prostate Stereotactic Body Radiotherapy in Seven Days
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Study of MR-guided Prostate Stereotactic Body Radiotherapy in Seven Days

brief_summary.textblock: The Proseven trial is a prospective interventional study that will evaluate the toxicity and efficacy of MR-guided stereotactic body radiotherapy (SBRT) in the profound hypofractionated treatment of prostate cancer. Patients will be treated in 5 daily fractions within a short overall treatment time (OTT) of 7 days. A simultaneous integrated boost (SIB) will be delivered to the intraprostatic dominant lesion (if present) in this study. Besides a potential biological impact of this innovative prostate SBRT treatment, the reduced OTT offers also benefits in terms of patient convenience. The primary endpoint is clinician reported grade 2 or more acute gastrointestinal (GI) and genitourinary (GU) toxicity, assessed using CTCAE v 5.0 and RTOG, measured up to 3 months after the first treatment fraction.

primary_outcome.measure: Acute toxicity according to CTCAE v 5.0
primary_outcome.time_frame: from the first treatment fraction up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Clinician reported grade 2 or more acute gastrointestinal (GI) or genitourinary (GU) toxicity, assessed using CTCAE v 5.0

primary_outcome.measure: Acute toxicity according to RTOG criteria
primary_outcome.time_frame: from the first treatment fraction up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Clinician reported grade 2 or more acute gastrointestinal (GI) or genitourinary (GU) toxicity, assessed using RTOG criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Late toxicity according to CTCAE v 5.0
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 5 years after start of radiotherapy
secondary_outcome.description: Clinician reported late toxicity, assessed using CTCAE v 5.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Late toxicity according to RTOG criteria
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 5 years after start of radiotherapy
secondary_outcome.description: Clinician reported late toxicity, assessed using RTOG criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the start of radiotherapy until 5 years after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life according to EORTC Quality of life Questionnaire C30

secondary_outcome.measure: Prostate specific quality of life assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the start of radiotherapy until 5 years after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life according to EORTC Quality of life Questionnaire PR25

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the start of radiotherapy until 5 years after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life according to Expanded Prostate Index Composite-26 (EPIC-26)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the start of radiotherapy until 5 years after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life according to International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from start of radiotherapy until PSA relapse, assessed up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: the Phoenix definition is used to define PSA failure (i.e. nadir + 2ng/mL)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from start of radiotherapy until 5 years after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: from start of radiotherapy until first evidence of recurrence (loco-regional or distant) or death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from start of radiotherapy until 5 years after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: from start of radiotherapy until death from any cause

arm_group.description: Patients will receive MR-guided RT in 5 fractions over 7 days (daily excluding weekend, i.e. start on Wednesday or Thursday, until Tuesday or Wednesday respectively the week after).

intervention.description: The dose to the planning target volume (PTV) is 36 Gy (5 x 7.2 Gy) prescribed on the 90% isodose line. The clinical target volume (CTV) is receiving 40 Gy (5 x 8 Gy = 100%). A simultaneous integrated boost (SIB) up to a total dose of 42 Gy (5 x 8.4 Gy = 105%) is delivered to the gross tumor volume (GTV), if present. In addition, relative sparing of the urethra will be applied by avoiding hotspots (V40 Gy < 1cc) in the urethra. Baseline and adapted treatment plans are generated using intensity-modulated RT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18 y
- Histologically confirmed prostate adenocarcinoma
- Low risk: cT1c-T2a, Gleason score 6, PSA < 10ng/mL
- Favorable intermediate risk: 1 intermediate risk factor, Gleason 3+4 or less, < 50% positive biopsy cores)
- Unfavorable intermediate risk: > 1 intermediate risk factor, Gleason 4+3, > 50% positive biopsy cores)
- Limited high risk: cT3a with PSA < 40ng/mL or cT2a-c with a Gleason score > 7 and/or a PSA > 20ng/mL but < 40ng/mL
- World Health Organization performance score 0-2
- Written informed consent
Intermediate risk factors: T2b-T2c, Gleason 7, PSA 10-20 ng/mL
Exclusion Criteria:
- Transurethral resection (TUR) < 3months before SBRT
- International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) > 19
- Prostate volume > 100cc on transrectal ultrasound (TRUS)
- Stage cT3b-T4
- N1 disease (clinically or pathologically)
- M1 disease (clinically or pathologically)
- PSA > 40ng/mL
- inflammatory bowel disease
- immunosuppressive medications
- prior pelvic RT
- contra-indications for MRI

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Radiotherapy, UZ Brussel, Vrije Universiteit Brussel

facility.name: Department of Radiotherapy, UZ Brussel, Vrije Universiteit Brussel
